mets:xmlData.dc:subject: Pony Express Museum
mets:xmlData.dc:description: William Parker Lyon Pony Express Museum. View of long covered shed with ground floor used for housing stage coach and wagons. Hanging from beams are harness with bells used on teams in years past to warn on-coming teams. Banner hangs from coach that reads "In a Moral Lecture." The pride of the stage-lines, the famous Concord Coach made by Abbott & Downing in Concord, New Hampshire, circa 1860s, predominates the foreground. A line of Western Mudwagons appear in the rear.
mets:xmlData.dc:source: Selected photograph from the William Parker Lyon Pony Express Museum Photograph Album (Document Box 31)
